definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
